resources.string: SalilMalkan
Wakanow
This app allows users to purchase plane tickets from Wakanow, a Nigerian travel agency.
I developed this app with a team of three other developers. My primary responsibility was making the user interface.
com.appek.wakanow
Referlocal iOS
This app allows iPhone users to purchase deals for local businesses from Referlocal.

I developed the first version of this app with a team of me, myself, and I. In addition to development my responsibilities included managing the project schedule & timeline, as well as interfacing with the client on a weekly basis.
http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/referlocal/id495246429?mt=8
Referlocal Android
This app allows Android users to purchase deals for local businesses from Referlocal.

I developed the first version of this app with one other developer. In addition to development my responsibilities included managing the project schedule & timeline, as well as interfacing with the client on a weekly basis.
com.appekapps.referlocal
VYTL Android
This app allows Android users to keep in touch with their business contacts.

I developed the first version of this app with one other developer. In addition to development my responsibilities included managing the project schedule & timeline, as well as interfacing with the client and API team on a weekly basis.
com.vytl
GTBank
This app allows GTBank customers to manage their bank account from their iPhone.
I developed this app with three other developer. My primary responsibility was making custom widgets and developing the user interface. This project has not yet been released.
Minigrip
This app allows Android users to browser the Minigrip reclosable bag catalog.
I developed this app with a team of me, myself, and I. I was also responsible for providing mentorship to our summer intern who was developing the iPhone version.
com.appekapps.minigrip
Row Row Row Remote

This was a personal project I developed in my free time with a friend. It is a canoe racing video game that is played on your computer, but controlled with your smart phone. The game is meant to be played with large groups of people.
I was primarily responsible for developing the server for this game as well as the web client which players use to control their canoes.
http://rowrowrowremote.com
Pathmapp
Pathmapp is a visual analytics platform for helping app owners see how users are interacting with their apps through the use of heatmaps. This project has not yet been released.
I was primarily responsible for research and prototyping in this project.
French Girls
French Girls is an app where strangers anonymously draw portraits based on selfies you have posted.
I helped develop the first version of the app, helped with the product idea and design, and helped with user and media outreach
https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/id607904602?mt=8
Manilla
Manilla is a personal finance app that let users keep track of upcoming bills, financial documents, and track their expenses.
I was responsible for development of our Android app, but I also worked simultaneously on the product team.
On August 18, 1989 I was born in Pune, India. Little did I know it then, but that was the beginning of a fantastic journey.
When I was three years old my parents decided to move the United States. I didn\'t really understand what that meant at the time; I was excited just for to fly in a plane.
When I was nine my parents bought our first family computer, an iMac G3. I thought it was the coolest thing ever and spent all of my time on it. We didn\'t even have an internet connection.
In my first year of high school I went over to a friend\'s house and he showed me a video game he had made on his PC. It blew my mind. I want to learn how to do that I said.
This was the year I graduated high school and moved away to college. Naturally, I became a computer science major.
A week after graduating from college I accepted my first job and finally got paid to do what had previously just been a hobby.
I moved to San Francisco and started everything all over. It\'s been nothing but an adventure.
I wonder what could be next. Maybe you could help me figure that out?
Call Me
I hope you\'re enjoying this little app I made for you. Give me a call at 415 400 6557 and let me know what you think.
salilmalkan@gmail.com
Email Me
Hi Salil! We\'d love to talk to you!
Hi Salil,\n\nWe\'re impressed with your development background and the products you\'ve built. We would love to chat with you about some career oppurtunities with us.
Hire Me Now
Screw it. We\'ll just hire you now.
Hi Salil,\n\nWe\'ve never hired anyone like this before, but screw it. We checked you out and we\'re convinced. We\'re ready to just hire you now.
